intro: Phrygilanthus falcatus, commonly known as the narrow-leafed phrygilanthus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or greenish-yellow in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
